abstract: Mayor Denis Coderre of Montreal says city will begin dumping about 2.1 billion gallons of raw sewage into St Lawrence River for possibly seven days in order to give workers time to repair prime collector sewer; Liberal government approved proposal after scientific review found plan was better option than sewer failure.
lead_paragraph: The mayor said the city would dump about 2.1 billion gallons of raw sewage into the St. Lawrence River.

headline.main: Canada: Montreal to Dump Sewage Into River During Repair Work
headline.print_headline: The Americas; Canada: Montreal to Dump Sewage Into River During Repair Work

snippet: The mayor said the city would dump about 2.1 billion gallons of raw sewage into the St. Lawrence River.
